Title: Orthogonal Fabry-Pérot sensors for photoacoustic tomography
Source: Progr. Biomed. Opt. Imaging Proc. SPIE
Abstract: © 2016 SPIE.Fabry-Pérot (FP) sensors have been used to produce in-vivo photoacoustic images of exquisite quality. However, for simplicity of construction FP sensors are produced in a planar form. Planar sensors suffer from a limited detection aperture, due to their planarity. We present a novel sensor geometry that allowed a greater field of view by placing a second sensor orthogonal to the first. This captured data from the deeper lying regions of interest and mitigated the limited view.
SubjectAreas: Atomic and Molecular Physics, and Optics
